docs.snippet: Three United States ships were launched yesterday. The first was the tanker-liner Delbrasil, which slid down the ways of the Bethlehem Steel Company's Sparrows Point yard in Baltimore.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three United States ships were launched yesterday. The first was the tanker-liner Delbrasil, which slid down the ways of the Bethlehem Steel Company's Sparrows Point yard in Baltimore.

headline.main: 3 SHIPS LAUNCHED TO CARRY OUR FLAG; Part of Maritime Commission Program to Construct 141 Vessels as Replacements ONE IS A TANKER-LINER Delbrasil Takes to Water at Baltimore--2 of C-2 Class Down Ways at Kearny

docs.snippet: While Finnish troops battled Russian in snowy forests and across frozen lakes and bogs, this call for help went out last week to the world. The republic of 4,000,000 persons was fighting for its life against a nation of 180,000,000. In a radio...
docs.lead_paragraph: While Finnish troops battled Russian in snowy forests and across frozen lakes and bogs, this call for help went out last week to the world. The republic of 4,000,000 persons was fighting for its life against a nation of 180,000,000. In a radio broadcast Foreign Minister Tanner told Moscow that Finland would make "far-reaching concessions" for peace, but that independence would be defended to the last man.

headline.main: World Aid?; The Finns Ask It

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sunday, Dec. 17--At daybreak this morning the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, poised for a dash for the sea, showed no signs of leaving the harbor.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sunday, Dec. 17--At daybreak this morning the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, poised for a dash for the sea, showed no signs of leaving the harbor.

headline.main: WARSHIP REPAIRED; Supply Boats on Duty at Montevideo Are Ordered Away REICH PRESSES FOR STAY Reported Sending a Flotilla to Cover Escape--Uruguay Calls Cabinet Session

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 16 --Wednesday's naval combat between the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee and the British cruisers Exeter, Ajax and Achilles has brought the European war closer to American shores than it had been brought before....

headline.main: SEA ENGAGEMENT IRKS AMERICAS; NAZI NAVAL CHIEF

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Monday, Dec. 18--Chancellor Adolf Hitler, as Supreme Commander of the German fighting forces, issued the order to sink the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee off Montevideo yesterday, it was announced early today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Monday, Dec. 18--Chancellor Adolf Hitler, as Supreme Commander of the German fighting forces, issued the order to sink the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee off Montevideo yesterday, it was announced early today.

headline.main: DECISION AT BERLIN; Hitler Consults Naval Heads--Plea to Stay in Uruguay Failed ISSUE MADE ON REPAIRS German Statement Earlier Said Raider-Warship Had 'Fulfilled Her Task'

byline.original: By PERCIVAL KNAUTH Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 --It was reported by well-informed sources here late tonight that Germany had presented a strong protest against Uruguay's action in refusing to permit the Admiral Graf Spee to remain longer in port here.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 --It was reported by well-informed sources here late tonight that Germany had presented a strong protest against Uruguay's action in refusing to permit the Admiral Graf Spee to remain longer in port here.
